docs.snippet: This year, Pixar, the animation studio that has been so successful in the past, is hoping for the top prize for its “Toy Story 3.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: This year, Pixar, the animation studio that has been so successful in the past, is hoping for the top prize for its “Toy Story 3.”

headline.seo: ‘Toy Story 3’ Is Pushed by Pixar for Best Picture Oscar

docs.snippet: Guys, we've put some thought into your Valentine's Day gifts so you don't have to....
docs.lead_paragraph: Guys, a word to the wise on Valentine's Day: jewelry. It's hard to go wrong. But that doesn't mean any old diamond bauble will do. Ask yourself, Who do you love? And shop accordingly. Silver or gold, rubies or pearls, trendy or vintage - we've put some thought into your Valentine's Day gifts so you don't have to.
docs.abstract: Guys, we've put some thought into your Valentine's Day gifts so you don't have to.

headline.main: The Way to Her Heart | A Valentine's Day Cheat Sheet

docs.snippet: The Taiwanese company Next Media Animation has produced another of its infamous cartoon news reports, this time about the Facebook founder and his alleged stalker....
docs.lead_paragraph: Now that the major Oscar races appear decided, the Bagger is feeling the liberty to take some coverage detours (because seriously, how many "King's Speech" dinners can we go to, anyway?). So: the Taiwanese company Next Media Animation has produced another of its infamous cartoon news reports, this time about Mark Zuckerberg (the protagonist of "The Social Network") and his alleged stalker. It somehow joins the outcry over Facebook's privacy settings with John Cusack's boombox moment from "Say Anything."
docs.abstract: The Taiwanese company Next Media Animation has produced another of its infamous cartoon news reports, this time about the Facebook founder and his alleged stalker.

docs.snippet: A new video takes the street artist's Oscar campaigning -- or un-campaigning -- to new extremes....
docs.lead_paragraph: As Oscar campaigns go, the street artist Banksy's is unusual - never showing up to schmooze (as far as we know), insulting other contenders, making a documentary that seems liked a hoax and leaving fellow filmmakers to debate whether that matters. A new video parodying his film, "Exit Through the Gift Shop," takes his uncampaigning even further. The "Exit Through the Pet Shop" trailer imagines what Banksy's movie would look like if it were populated by Keyboard Cats and I Can Has Cheezburger.
docs.abstract: A new video takes the street artist's Oscar campaigning -- or un-campaigning -- to new extremes.

docs.snippet: Danny Boyle is busy working on a theatrical production of "Frankenstein," which will be broadcast in U.S. cinemas next month. And Morgan Spurlock is accused of plagiarism....
docs.lead_paragraph: When the Bagger last spoke with Danny Boyle on Oscar nominations day, he was treating himself to a cab ride home after rehearsals for his stage production of "Frankenstein." The play, now running at the National Theater in London, stars Benedict Cumberbatch and Jonny Lee Miller, who are alternating in the roles of Victor Frankenstein and the Creature; the first 10 weeks are sold out. But American audiences will get a chance to see it anyway; according to a new announcement, it will be broadcast in American movie houses on March 17. Add your own "It's ALIVE!" joke here.
docs.abstract: Danny Boyle is busy working on a theatrical production of "Frankenstein," which will be broadcast in U.S. cinemas next month. And Morgan Spurlock is accused of plagiarism.

headline.main: It's Alive: U.S. Movie Theaters to Show Danny Boyle's 'Frankenstein'

docs.snippet: "Incendies," Denis Villeneuve's Oscar-nominated film, explores anger in both its intimate and larger political forms....
docs.lead_paragraph: Of the five nominees for this year's Oscar for best foreign-language film, four are based on original scripts. The exception is Canada's "Incendies," which its director, Denis Villeneuve, adapted from the French-language play of the same name, written by the Lebanese-born Canadian playwright Wajdi Mouawad and known in English as "Scorched."
docs.abstract: "Incendies," Denis Villeneuve's Oscar-nominated film, explores anger in both its intimate and larger political forms.

headline.main: Violence, Hope and an Oscar Nomination

docs.snippet: 10 P.M. (TV Land) HOT IN CLEVELAND They're calling this one ''Sisterhood of the Traveling Spanx'': an undergarment has mysterious effects on the lives of the women as Melanie (Valerie Bertinelli, above, with Jack Wagner) chases after a doctor (Mr....
docs.lead_paragraph: 10 P.M. (TV Land) HOT IN CLEVELAND They're calling this one ''Sisterhood of the Traveling Spanx'': an undergarment has mysterious effects on the lives of the women as Melanie (Valerie Bertinelli, above, with Jack Wagner) chases after a doctor (Mr. Wagner); Victoria (Wendie Malick) gets into a row with Melanie Griffith after an audition; Joy (Jane Leeves) finds romance with a younger man; and Elka (Betty White) puts some team spirit behind Grady Sizemore of the Cleveland Indians. In ''Retired at 35,'' at 10:30, Alan (George Segal) and Elaine (Jessica Walter) compete for the affections of their son, David (Johnathan McClain), by lavishing expensive gifts on him. 9 A.M. (ABC) LIVE! WITH REGIS AND KELLY The first lady, Michelle Obama, discusses her ''Let's Move'' campaign to fight childhood obesity and the strides the program has made in its first year.

docs.snippet: Sydney Pollack's 1982 comedy was nominated for 10 Academy Awards. A. O. Scott reflects on the film....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sydney Pollack's 1982 film, "Tootsie," which stars Dustin Hoffman as an actor who poses as a woman to land a television role, made an impact on the Academy, receiving 10 Oscar nominations, including best picture. Jessica Lange, who was nominated in two categories that year, won the supporting actress Oscar for her performance in the film. This week's Critics' Picks video looks back on the comedy and sheds some light on why it struck such a chord. A. O. Scott's video can be found on our sister blog, ArtsBeat.
docs.abstract: Sydney Pollack's 1982 comedy was nominated for 10 Academy Awards. A. O. Scott reflects on the film.

docs.snippet: Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, the 6'5" Olympic rowers and Harvard grads (if you listen to everybody) and actual founders of Facebook (if you listen to them), are again asserting their claims to the social networking site....
docs.lead_paragraph: It's always a good day for the Bagger when there is Winkelvi news. Happily, Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, the 6'5" Olympic rowers and Harvard grads (if you listen to everybody) and actual founders of Facebook (if you listen to them), are pretty comfortable in the spotlight. They are featured in a video interview in The Daily, the new iPad publication from Rupert Murdoch (with a logo that's startlingly Facebook blue), in which they again assert their claims to the social networking site, and to looking extremely fit. Their real problem, they maintain, is that Mark Zuckerberg -- a real founder of Facebook, according to most courts and viewers of "The Social Network" - believes that the situation is "all about him."
docs.abstract: Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, the 6'5" Olympic rowers and Harvard grads (if you listen to everybody) and actual founders of Facebook (if you listen to them), are again asserting their claims to the social networking site.

headline.main: The Winklevi Step Up Their Facebook Offensive

docs.snippet: The composers Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross did not follow the exacting requests of Aaron Sorkin, the Oscar-nominated screenwriter for "The Social Network."...
docs.lead_paragraph: The elements behind the success of "The Social Network," as its makers rarely tire of telling us, were an odd mix. There were no stars, save for a pop singer; a subject that was an Internet punch line even before the Internet heard its actual punch lines; directed by a visual mastermind, David Fincher, and based on the pulsing dialogue of Aaron Sorkin - both of them big personalities with opposing styles. Mr. Fincher has been nominated for an Oscar and Mr. Sorkin has already been rewarded; he just won the Writers Guild of America award for best adapted screenplay and is likely to pick up the Oscar in that category as well. At the Writers Guild ceremony in Los Angeles, he made sure to spread the credit to his collaborator. "I wrote a good screenplay," he said, "but David Fincher made a great movie."
docs.abstract: The composers Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross did not follow the exacting requests of Aaron Sorkin, the Oscar-nominated screenwriter for "The Social Network."
